result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Court Appointed Attorney's Fees in the amount of $623.00 are paid in full from deposits previously paid.  The remaining balance of the deposit funds of $127.00 has been applied to the costs imposed.
Defendant to comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program and any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Supervising Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Character letters given to the Court at the November 5, 2015 Sentencing Hearing on Revocation

Case called @ 3:47 p.m. Defendant Tyrone Peterson in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Defendant Tyrone Peterson in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be made. The parties stipulation to 157 days CFTS. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Zamzow. No statement by DE. Court orders: 9 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, 157 days CFTS, Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-05-2015 03:45 pm

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:28 PM: Defendant Tyrone N. Peterson in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA with argued terms on sentencing.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Argument by ADA - argues for 2 yr probation term.  Argument by Atty Zamzow - argues for lesser probation term.  Statement by Def:  Yes, apologizes for all the confusion.  The Court:  S/W - 18 mos probation.  Conditions:  Comply with all SO requirements and any other terms as deemed appropriate by Agent; Court anticipates that all SO programming has already been satisfied - not reimposed again; Court Costs plus DNA surcharge - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.  Supervision to be transferred to Sauk Co.  Atty Zamzow Ct Appt Fees also imposed.  Atty Zamzow notes for the record that Def does not have a middle initial. Clerk confirms address is correct.  Court amends name to delete middle initial.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow requesting a P/S hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on December 8, 2014 at 03:05 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 03:05 pm.

Case Called @ 1:18 PM: Defendant Tyrone N. Peterson in court.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel, was not eligible for SPD services.  Based upon earnings discussions as to self-employment, Court believes Def should be able to retain own counsel, however, the Court will appoint counsel if by 8/29/14 Def post $250 deposit for Court Appointment.  Commencing 10/1/14 $100 per mo PP.   IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
